instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No USB ports
threads.message:
I have a 13" MacBook pro (Early 2011)

neither USB ports are "working".

Each will light up a mouse for a split second and then goes dark.

Both have the 5V. 

J4600 which also acts like a SMC debug port has SEL 10 HI (3.4v) and of course OE is low since it is GND. This should select USB, instead of SMC...

J4610 no mux, just straight up USB and it has 5v, but not lighting mouse for more than a split second (or my USB drive that has activity light built in)

No liquid damage. 

Machine boots and runs just like it should, other than USB issue. iSight camera works, and built in keyboard and trackpad work (they're on a "USB" hub)

Any ideas? 

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No USB ports
threads.message: Usually bad L4600 and L4610..... or bad <DIODE>D4600</DIODE>-<DIODE>D4610</DIODE>... First check the coils.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No USB ports
threads.message: What would cause both ports, not just one, to go bad?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No USB ports
threads.message: A bad L4600 and L4610.....Measure on diode mode on both USB data lines, one or more will be broken.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No USB ports
threads.message:
L4610: 0L on PIN 3
            0.626 on PIN 2
            0.617 on PIN 4
            0.623 on PIN 1

replaced L4610 and now BOTH USB work... Why would L4610 affect the other USB port???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No USB ports
threads.message: No, L4600 is probably intermittent too. Why are you going out of your way to not just replace 2 simple coils?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No USB ports
threads.message:
Diode measured L4610 and it had the 0L and L4600 measured just fine. That's why I asked the question. Thank you for clarifying on why L4610 could affect L4600... it doesn't. Just gonna go bad sooner or later too. I'll replace it too

thank you.
